description: This file appears to be a Python source code file responsible for generating C++ code related to JSON-RPC event and method emission, registration, and deregistration, including support for various serialization formats and event handling.

methods.name: EmitEvent(emit, root, event, params_type, legacy = False)
methods.description: Generates code for JSON-RPC event emission, creating function prototypes, handling parameters, and serialization logic.

methods.name: _EmitRpcPrologue(root, emit, header_file, source_file, ns, data_emitted, prototypes = [])
methods.description: Creates the prologue section of the RPC code with includes, namespace declarations, and version info.

methods.name: _EmitRpcEpilogue(root, emit, ns)
methods.description: Creates the epilogue section of the RPC code to close namespaces.

methods.name: _EmitVersionCode(emit, version)
methods.description: Generates version declaration code for the RPC interface.

methods.name: _EmitRpcCode(root, emit, ns, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Generates the full RPC registration, deregistration, and event code segments, including method registration, event listener registration, and cleanup.

methods.name: EmitRpcCode(root, emit, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Coordinates the emission of full RPC code, including prologue, main code, and epilogue.

methods.name: EmitRpcVersionCode(root, emit, header_file, source_file, data_emitted)
methods.description: Emits versioning information for the RPC interface, wrapping calls to prologue and epilogue.

methods.name: _Invoke(params, response, use_prefix = True, const_cast = False, parent = "", repsonse_parent = "")

ctags.pattern: /^def EmitEvent(emit, root, event, params_type, legacy = False):$/
